page.title: 03AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE 1
page.content: The College is in the village of {Holme Lacy,}at the western end. There are 32 full-time students and 50 who come daily. Their average age is 17. They are taught land-based industries such as{farming, forestry, {horticulture, and careers for the {girls. There are{500 acres (202 hectares)}on which are grown{wheat, barley, {sugar-beet, maize, oats, rye, fodder {turnips, and grass. There are also 6 acres of{cider apples and 3 acres of buildings. The college owns part of the old railway track, and the students use it as a{nature trail.
